description: This paper investigates the differences in handover behavior when humans transfer hazardous objects versus safe objects using a high-resolution touch sensor. It highlights how these findings can inform safer human-robot interactions.

title.value: A Study of Human-Robot Handover through Human-Human Object Transfer
title.justification: This title accurately represents the paper's content, focusing on human-robot handover through human-human object transfer.
title.quote: A Study of Human-Robot Handover through Human-Human Object Transfer

type.justification: The paper involves conducting experiments to observe handover behavior, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: we propose a methodology to study human-human handover using a haptic hand-held tactile device.

research_field.justification: The paper focuses on understanding human-robot interactions, which is a core area in the field of Human-Computer Interaction.
research_field.quote: In this paper, we consider the exchange of objects between humans and robots, as well as the contextual factors that modulate this behaviour.

sub_research_field.justification: The paper emphasizes the role of tactile feedback in handover interactions, making it fall under the sub-field of haptics and tactile interaction.
sub_research_field.quote: we investigate changes in handover behaviour when transferring hazardous objects with the help of a high-resolution touch sensor.

name.justification: This dataset represents the control study of human-human handovers without any tactile sensors.
name.quote: the first where one participant wears the visuotactile sensor and a control study where neither participants had sensors.

name.justification: The dataset involves recordings of human-human handovers using a haptic sensor to collect tactile and visual data.
name.quote: We design a wrist-mounted tactile enabled finger that allows researchers to collect large datasets of human-human handover interactions while recording visual and tactile sensory feedback.
